page.title: 15WORK IN PETERSFIELD 1
page.content:
A BLACKSMITH
My Dad is a blacksmith. Nowadays he makes gates, stakes, large staples, weather vanes for churches, railings, fire escapes, lightning conductors and lots more. Before the war they had many rollers and traction engines all worked by steam. After the war the owner was wanting someone to help him but everyone was finding the work too hard. But my Dad said he would do it and has now been there nearly 40 years and finds it interesting and fun. In the l830s about thirty coaches a day came through Petersfield. Many of them stopped to change horses. The main work at the forge was shoeing horses and making the metal parts for carriages. Nowadays there is very little of this kind of work.
